posts.post_content: Phobia, it works because the Exiling of Mangara is part of the resolution. You declare the ability and pick the target, then you have a window of opportunity before Mangara and the target poof. During this gap, you can move Mangara to a different zone, which will cause the game to lose track of it. It will then do what it can of the pending ability, exiling the target and failing to find the Mangara, causing that part of the effect to pass with no effect.
posts.html:
Phobia, it works because the Exiling of Mangara is part of the resolution. You declare the ability and pick the target, then you have a window of opportunity before Mangara and the target poof. During this gap, you can move Mangara to a different zone, which will cause the game to lose track of it. It will then do what it can of the pending ability, exiling the target and failing to find the Mangara, causing that part of the effect to pass with no effect.

posts.post_content: Ephinophobia: You're showing your age, as a Magic player. Removing the source of the ability hasn't countered the ability since before at least Sixth Edition rules. If they wanted the ability to work as you say it should, it would be phrased "![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol): If Mangara of Corondor is in play, exile Mangara and target permanent."

posts.post_content: @JL2736: If you're talking about giving Mangara shroud to protect him from exile, it won't work, since Mangara's ability doesn't target himself, giving him shroud won't prevent him from being exiled. You can, however, untap him using the aura, since exiling himself is part of the ability and not the cost, you can activate his ability, then untap him, and then activate, then untap...
posts.html:
@JL2736: If you're talking about giving Mangara shroud to protect him from exile, it won't work, since Mangara's ability doesn't target himself, giving him shroud won't prevent him from being exiled. In a B / W deck...  
Turn one: Swamp. Dark ritual, [Trinisphere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trinisphere)  
Turn two: Plains  
Turn three: Plains, This  
Turn four: It's time to exile some lands.  
  
Just one of many ways to abuse Trinisphere (who's idea was it to reprint that thing seriously) and a use for making your opponents stay several mana below you.
